If these accumulated gains or losses exceed 10% of the greater of the market-related value of plan assets or plan obligations, a portion is amortized into the income statement. The amortization period depends on the plan: for active participants, it is based on the average remaining service life (approximately 11 years), and for inactive participants, it is based on the remaining life expectancy (approximately 26 years).
